data.prayer: Father, you said, "The earth belongs to Me and all that is in it". Please, call Jizzakh, Uzbekistan into obedience and eternal life.
data.verse: The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness; the world, and those who dwell therein.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Jizzakh, Uzbekistan
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Father, may the churches in Jizzakh, Uzbekistan honor local leaders who work hard for the flock of God.
data.verse: Pay careful attention to yourselves and to all the flock, in which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to care for the church of God, which he obtained with his own blood.

data.section_summary: On average, 60 people will die without Jesus in the next 100 hours in Jizzakh, Uzbekistan.
data.prayer: Father, send your gospel to these.
Jesus, teach the believers in the state of Jizzakh that love for you and obedience to you are connected.
data.verse: If you love me, keep my commands.

data.prayer: Father, please, raise up a generation of disciples in the state of Jizzakh who will make disciples who make disciples.
Father, open to your people a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ to the Tatar people.
Father, guide the church in Jizzakh, Uzbekistan to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.prayer: Father, like with the Ethiopian Eunuch, set up a meeting today between a faithful believer in Jizzakh, Uzbekistan and a person seeking to understand the truth.
data.verse: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?” Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

data.prayer: Father, you know every soul, and you know who are yours and who are yet to be yours out of the 910,500 people living in Jizzakh, Uzbekistan. Please, call your lost sheep to yourself.
data.verse: For I will take you out of the nations; I will gather you from all the countries and bring you back into your own land.

location.name: Jizzakh
location.cities_list: Jizzax, Zomin Shaharchasi, Gagarin Shahri, Paxtakor Shahri, Dashtobod
location.cities_list_w_pop: Jizzax (152,642), Zomin Shaharchasi (27,077), Gagarin Shahri (24,856), Paxtakor Shahri (21,384), Dashtobod (19,718)
